{"step_by_step_thinking": "The maxillary sinus is one of the paranasal sinuses located in the maxillary bone. It is the largest of the paranasal sinuses and is located below the eyes, on either side of the nose. The maxillary sinus drains into the nasal cavity through an opening called the ostium. To determine where the maxillary sinus drains, we need to identify the location of the ostium. The ostium of the maxillary sinus is located in the middle meatus of the nasal cavity. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Middle meatus.", "answer_choice": "A"}
